<html><head><title>Rounded Table Corners Tutorial - Part 1</title>
<!--Description and keywords generated by script--><meta name="description" content="Find out how to create rounded corners for tables on your website and how to create some design effects using them.  (Free Webmaster Help)">
<meta name="keywords" content="corners, table, website, design, edges, lines, background, tables, rounded, round, smooth, learn, tutorial, information">
<!-- Standard Heading -->
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
<script language="JavaScript">
<!--
function MM_swapImgRestore() { //v3.0
  var i,x,a=document.MM_sr; for(i=0;a&&i<a.length&&(x=a[i])&&x.oSrc;i++) x.src=x.oSrc;
}

function MM_preloadImages() { //v3.0
  var d=document; if(d.images){ if(!d.MM_p) d.MM_p=new Array();
    var i,j=d.MM_p.length,a=MM_preloadImages.arguments; for(i=0; i<a.length; i++)
    if (a[i].indexOf("#")!=0){ d.MM_p[j]=new Image; d.MM_p[j++].src=a[i];}}
}

function MM_findObj(n, d) { //v4.0
  var p,i,x;  if(!d) d=document; if((p=n.indexOf("?"))>0&&parent.frames.length) {
    d=parent.frames[n.substring(p+1)].document; n=n.substring(0,p);}
  if(!(x=d[n])&&d.all) x=d.all[n]; for (i=0;!x&&i<d.forms.length;i++) x=d.forms[i][n];
  for(i=0;!x&&d.layers&&i<d.layers.length;i++) x=MM_findObj(n,d.layers[i].document);
  if(!x && document.getElementById) x=document.getElementById(n); return x;
}

function MM_swapImage() { //v3.0
  var i,j=0,x,a=MM_swapImage.arguments; document.MM_sr=new Array; for(i=0;i<(a.length-2);i+=3)
   if ((x=MM_findObj(a[i]))!=null){document.MM_sr[j++]=x; if(!x.oSrc) x.oSrc=x.src; x.src=a[i+2];}
}
//-->
</script>

            			<!-- Page Title -->
                       <p align="center"><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="5"><b><font color="#000099" size="6">
                       Rounded Table Corners Tutorial<br>
              <font size="4" color="#000000">Part 1 - Introduction</font></font></b></font></p>

              <!-- Links To Other Tutorial Parts -->
              <font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><ul><li><b>Part 1 - Introduction</b></li><li><a href="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/tutorials/corners/2">Part 2 - Advanced Corners</a></li></ul></font>

              <!-- Page Content -->
              <p><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2">
              <div align="right" style="float:right">
<iframe src="http://rcm.amazon.com/e/cm?t=freewebmaster-20&o=1&p=14&l=st1&mode=books&search=rounded table corners&fc1=000000&lt1=&lc1=3366FF&bg1=FFFFFF&f=ifr" marginwidth="0" marginheight="0" width="160" height="600" border="0" frameborder="0" style="border:none;" scrolling="no"></iframe>
</div><font face="Arial" color="#000099"><big><b>Introduction</b></big></font><br />
<br />
One of the best effects which you can use on your website to make it look more professional is rounded table corners. They can be used very effectively to create borders, blocks of colour, navigation bars and many other effects. Throughout this tutorial we will show you how do this.<br />
<br />
The software used in this tutorial is Macromedia Fireworks but you can use nearly any image software.<br />
<br />
<font face="Arial" color="#000099"><big><b>Creating The Table</b></big></font><br />
<br />
The first example in this tutorial will be a table looking like this:<br />
<table width="200" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr bgcolor="#FF0000"><td><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><img src="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/static/tutorials/corners/topleft.gif" width="25" height="25"></font></td><td>&nbsp;</td><td align="right"><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><img src="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/static/tutorials/corners/topright.gif" width="25" height="25"></font></td></tr><tr bgcolor="#FF0000"><td>&nbsp;</td><td><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><b><font color="#FFFFFF">This is where your table content is placed if you want it there.</font></b></font></td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr><tr bgcolor="#FF0000"><td><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><img src="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/static/tutorials/corners/bottomleft.gif" width="25" height="25"></font></td><td>&nbsp;</td><td align="right"><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><img src="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/static/tutorials/corners/bottomright.gif" width="25" height="25"></font></td></tr></table><br />
A simple block of colour with rounded corners. Firstly, you create a normal coloured table but slightly different to how you would normally do it. You should add 2 rows and 2 columns to the table you want (for example if you want a table with one cell you should create one with 3 rows and 3 columns as follows:<br />
<table width="200" border="1" cellspacing="2" cellpadding="2"><tr><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr></table><br />
The central cell will be used for your content and the other ones will be for the edging. You should set the border, cell padding and cell spacing of the table to zero for this to work.<br />
<br />
Before you create the corners you will need to make the table the right colours. Set the background of all the cells to the colour red (#FF0000).<br />
<table width="200" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr bgcolor="#FF0000"><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr><tr bgcolor="#FF0000"><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr><tr bgcolor="#FF0000"><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr></table><br />
<br />
<font face="Arial" color="#000099"><big><b>Creating The Images</b></big></font><br />
<br />
The actual corners for the table are created using 4 images. This is where your graphics program is required. Firstly, create a new image with a white background which is 25 pixels high and 25 pixels wide. Choose the circle tool and draw a circle touching the edges of the image but with only quarter of the circle in the image li<br />
ke this:<br />
<img src="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/static/tutorials/corners/draw.gif" width="100" height="84" alt="Drawing The Circle"><br />
Next, set the fill colour of the circle to red which will produce this:<br />
<img src="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/static/tutorials/corners/cornerpic.gif" width="56" height="48" alt="The Corner"><br />
Finally, export or save the image as topleft.gif<br />
<br />
Then, use the rotate function to rotate the image 90 degrees clockwise, save it as topright.gif. Rotate it another 90 degrees and save it as bottomright.gif then do it one more time and save it as bottomleft.gif. You should now have a set of images like this:<br />
<img src="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/static/tutorials/corners/topleft.gif" width="25" height="25"><img src="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/static/tutorials/corners/topright.gif" width="25" height="25"><img src="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/static/tutorials/corners/bottomleft.gif" width="25" height="25"><img src="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/static/tutorials/corners/bottomright.gif" width="25" height="25"><br />
<br />
<font face="Arial" color="#000099"><big><b>Creating The Table</b></big></font><br />
<br />
Now all you have to do is insert these images in your table. In each of the corner cells place the appropriate image. You will now have something which looks like this:<br />
<table width="200" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr bgcolor="#FF0000"><td><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><img src="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/static/tutorials/corners/topleft.gif" width="25" height="25"></font></td><td>&nbsp;</td><td><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><img src="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/static/tutorials/corners/topright.gif" width="25" height="25"></font></td></tr><tr bgcolor="#FF0000"><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</d><td>&nbsp;</td></tr><tr bgcolor="#FF0000"><td><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><img src="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/static/tutorials/corners/bottomleft.gif" width="25" height="25"></font></td><td>&nbsp;</td><td><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><img src="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/static/tutorials/corners/bottomright.gif" width="25" height="25"></font></td></tr></table><br />
Now all you need to do is set the alignment of the two right cells to &#039;right&#039; and your table will nearly be complete. Just add the text to the center cell and you now have a table with rounded corners:<br />
<table width="200" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr bgcolor="#FF0000"><td><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><img src="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/static/tutorials/corners/topleft.gif" width="25" height="25"></font></td><td>&nbsp;</td><td align="right"><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><img src="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/static/tutorials/corners/topright.gif" width="25" height="25"></font></td></tr><tr bgcolor="#FF0000"><td>&nbsp;</td><td><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><b><font color="#FFFFFF">This is where your table content is placed if you want it there.</font></b></font></td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr><tr bgcolor="#FF0000"><td><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><img src="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/static/tutorials/corners/bottomleft.gif" width="25" height<br />
="25"></font></td><td>&nbsp;</td><td align="right"><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><img src="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/static/tutorials/corners/bottomright.gif" width="25" height="25"></font></td></tr></table><br />
<br />
<font face="Arial" color="#000099"><big><b>Part 2</b></big></font><br />
<br />
In part two I will show you how you can use this same technique to create inside corners for your table, creating a frame round your content.</font></p>

              <!-- Bottom Navigation -->
              <table width="100%" cellspacing="2" cellpadding="2" border="0">
              <tr>
              
              
              
              <!-- Links To Other Tutorial Parts -->
              <td width="50%" valign="top"><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><ul><li><b>Part 1 - Introduction</b></li><li><a href="http://www.freewebmasterhelp.com/tutorials/corners/2">Part 2 - Advanced Corners</a></li></ul></font></p></td>
              
              <!-- Related Links -->
              <td width="50%" valign="top">
              <font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size="2"><ul>

</ul></font>
</td>

			 <!-- End Bottom Navigation -->
			 </tr></table>
